summary_about_you: Hung Yin Chen (Kelly) is a highly motivated AI engineer with a Master's degree in Artificial Intelligence from Duke University and a Bachelor's degree in Management Science, Industrial and Information Management from National Cheng Kung University. She has a robust technical skillset, including Python, LLMs, Computer Vision, AWS, Google Cloud, Git, SQL, Power BI, and Tableau. Kelly has demonstrated her expertise through her work at Hera Fertility and Earthbook, where she developed AI-powered systems and machine learning models, respectively. She has also shown her ability to communicate technical insights effectively through her work as a Data Visualization Intern at National Taiwan University. Kelly is a go-getter with a growth mindset, known for her problem-solving abilities and commitment to achieving results. She thrives in fast-paced environments and is always eager to contribute to team success.
why_this_role_interests_you: As an AI Researcher with a Master's degree in Artificial Intelligence, I am particularly interested in this role at Armada because it aligns with my professional skills and aspirations. I am drawn to the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects in AI and ML, leveraging my experience in model building, data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model performance optimization. I also have a strong background in Python and relevant AI/ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, which I believe would be instrumental in this role. Moreover, Armada's mission to bridge the digital divide using advanced technology resonates with me deeply. I am excited about the prospect of using my skills to contribute to this meaningful cause. Lastly, the fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment described is precisely the kind of stimulating setting in which I thrive.
relevant_projects:
1. "Fundus Image Prediction for Diabetic Retinopathy @ Duke Spring 2025: Built computer vision-based deep learning models for diabetic retinopathy detection, improving F1 score by 32% over classical ML models, achieving 0.8214 F1 with VGG16. Applied Explainable AI (Grad-CAM) for model interpretability, measuring Intersection over Union with the expert-labelled dataset, and built a web application for real-time diabetic retinopathy detection."
   
2. "RAG-Based Career Guidance System @ Duke Spring 2025: Built a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)-based career guidance system by implementing text processing, semantic search, and retrieval pipelines, improving career insights from diverse resumes."

3. "Automated Evaluation of Startup Pitches @ Duke Spring 2025: Developed an AI tool to evaluate startup pitches using GPT-4o scoring and deep learning models (BERT, Llama3.2) on ~500 YC videos. Achieved a QWK score of 0.72 by fine-tuning Llama3.2 with chain-of-thought distillation, outperforming traditional ML approaches by 48%."
technical_skills: Technical skills: Python, R, Java, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, Pandas, NumPy, SQL, Deep Learning, NLP, Computer Vision
career_goals: Given her extensive experience and academic background in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, Kelly's career goal is to take on challenging roles in AI and ML where she can apply her knowledge and skills in developing cutting-edge technologies. She aims to contribute significantly to the AI domain, particularly in the areas of deep learning applications and large language models. She is also interested in exploring research opportunities to stay updated on the latest advancements in AI and continually improve her technical abilities. Her ultimate goal is to develop AI solutions that can solve real-world issues and make a meaningful impact on society.
